page.title: 05FORT REGENT,ST.HELIER
page.content: Originally a military garrison built in 1806, Fort Regent is now the island's major leisure centre. Converted during the 1970's after much heated local debate,the Fort now provides a large indoor swimming pool, a multi-pupose sports complex catering for badminton, squash, snooker, 5 a side football, etc., a Piazza area where shows are put on in the tourist season and a 2000 seat auditorium. There are museums, a disco,an aquarium and a small funfair,while gardens with aviaries provide a place to relax. The Fort is served by a multi storey car park and by a cable car service from the town centre. The large central rotunda has still not been developed,but the Fort does provide for visitor and local alike. Summer 1985 entry fees are Â£2.50 for adults,and Â£1.75 for children.
